meanings.definition: Remove faded flowers from (a plant) to encourage further blooming.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy deadheading my roses to make them bloom more.
meanings.sent2: She deadheads the daisies in her garden every week.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that deadheading was like giving the flowers a haircut.
meanings.sent4: Deadheading the plants is like giving them a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: Deadheading is like a magic trick for making flowers look prettier.

meanings.definition: A person who travels without paying, especially on public transportation.
meanings.sent1: The train conductor caught a deadheading passenger on the subway.
meanings.sent2: Deadheading on buses is not allowed and can result in a fine.
meanings.sent3: The deadheading passenger tried to sneak past the ticket inspector.
meanings.sent4: The deadheading traveler hopped on the train without a ticket.
meanings.sent5: The deadheading individual was caught red-handed by the bus driver.

meanings.definition: A flight crew member who is traveling as a passenger to their next assignment.
meanings.sent1: The deadheading flight attendant relaxed in the passenger seat.
meanings.sent2: The deadheading pilot sat quietly in the back of the plane.
meanings.sent3: The deadheading crew member enjoyed the flight without any duties.
meanings.sent4: The deadheading staff member blended in with the other passengers.
meanings.sent5: The deadheading airline employee was off-duty and on their way to work.
